HÅ«á¹ƒ svÄhÄ The Buddha told VajrapÄá¹‡i Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva:

Reciting this mantra of Vajra Lord's accomplishment mudra, abiding in great tranquility, far removed from all mental states, in the moon-like love samÄdhi, the white tuft wheel, contemplating and illuminating clearly and pervasively, all tathÄgatas' vajra great maá¹‡i wish-fulfilling jewels, of the same dharma-nature, one true dharma realm, one flavor as suchness, neither coming nor going, formless and unconditioned, the pure dharma body illuminates the ocean of quiescent extinction.
Thus, these eight hundred vajra phrases originally arise from one dharma of samÄdhi,
Contemplating and illuminating the non-dual gate of suchness, one enters the tathÄgata's ocean of quiescent extinction.
Well knowing the phrases of emergence and entry, the yoga accomplishments and various rituals,
The myriad practices of bodhi are cultivated in a single moment, forever leaving behind beginningless delusions.
The eighty-four thousand sublime dharma gates, entering with a single syllable true word mudrÄ,
The merits of the Ganges sands are incalculable, widely liberating sentient beings to the utmost.
The emptiness of persons, the emptiness of dharmas, the emptiness of self-nature, the originally empty one true dharma realm,
The tathÄgatas of the ten directions all rely on this vajra phrase.
Each phrase, each seal, each true word, first spread from the heart wheel to the top of the head,ğŸ”½To the two shoulders, left and right ears, the two tips, the white tuft between the eyebrows,
The two cheeks above the neck, the mark between the eyebrows, the lips, teeth, eyes, palate, and throat,
The two arms and ten fingers are the pÄramitÄs, the chest, back, and two feet,
The navel wheel, next above the vajra palace, the mind king resides in the bright pearl treasury,
Adorned everywhere with jeweled banners and jeweled parasols, without characteristics, neither coming nor going,
The two eyes are the vajra lamp of the lotus flower, the nose faculty is the place of joy, play, unguents, and incense,
Sitting peacefully in the vajra wheel of siddhi, pure light like a full moon,
In this way, the body and mind of one hundred and eight, sequentially contemplate and make clear and pure,
Suddenly realizing the secret bodhi seal, freely traveling the path of nirvana,
Having established the siddhi of the world, then relying on the abhiá¹£eka to perform recitation,
Truly the excellent son of the TathÄgata, fulfilling the pure dharma of the One Vehicle,
The armies of devas and mÄras, seeing this person, join palms and say, World-saver.
Again it is said, The immovable wisdom of vajra, the place of ultimately attaining the dharmakÄya of buddhahood,
In the Chapter on the Ultimate Meaning of the Yoga [SÅ«tra], it is said, Gazing up at it, just like the world-leader,
Transmitting the secret door of the BhagavÄn, the eight classes of spiritual beings and devas all look up to it with respect.
When wishing to walk or sit and recite, the characteristics of speech when exhaling and inhaling purity,
The golden vajra held in the mouth, the two eyes with maá¹­a removing past hindrances,
Always contemplating sitting in the bright moon mirror, pervading the Dharma realm with the measure of empty space,
The mind attains mastery, without going or coming, the merits always practiced are universally dedicated.
Entering the Dharma-body Contemplation Gate:
Bowing to Vairocana Buddha, the vajra-peak of all tathÄgatas,
In the great Dharma realm's site of enlightenment, single-mindedly contemplating and clearly seeing,
The wondrous and lofty is extremely rare, with spiritual and holy power ascending to its peak,
Universally observing the buddha-lands of the ten directions, like a maá¹‡i jewel in the palm,
Realizing this samÄdhi of Å›Å«raá¹ƒgama, peacefully abiding in the auspicious ground of the tathÄgatas.
Bowing to Vairocana Buddha, the vajra-king of all tathÄgatas,
The ocean of tranquil light and self-mastery, the supreme one praised in the ten directions,
With merits as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, all perfectly complete, formless, pure, and equal to true emptiness,
Awakening to this samÄdhi, the key to enlightenment, peacefully abiding in the auspicious ground of the TathÄgata.
I bow to Vairocana Buddha, the vajra peak of all tathÄgatas,
The crown protrusion boundless, invisible, surpassing the oceans of worlds in the ten directions.
Thousands of cliffs and valleys, maá¹‡i jewels, reflected in the vessels of lapis lazuli and crystal,
Awakening to this samÄdhi, the jewel of myriad forms, peacefully abiding in the auspicious ground of the TathÄgata.
I bow to Vairocana Buddha, the vajra life of all tathÄgatas,
With an immeasurable lifespan beyond calculation, the land of utmost bliss with water birds, trees, and forests,
People suddenly born within flowers, birds emerging from pearls singing Dharma sounds,
The Bodhisattva bathes in the golden sand water, and in one thought, the ten directions are completely entrusted.
Realizing this swift and irreversible contemplation, one abides in the auspicious ground of the TathÄgata.
I bow to Vairocana Buddha, the vajra seat of all TathÄgatas,
The ocean seal, the treasures of the Ganges sands, the siddhis - the boundless Well-Gone Ones ascend upon it.
The perfect light of the Dharma realm is unobstructed, like observing the moon in water and reflections in a mirror.
The lion bears it, filling the sky - the seven treasures, the golden lotus, the jeweled umbrella canopy,
Realizing this samÄdhi siddhi seal, one abides in the auspicious ground of the TathÄgata.
I bow to Vairocana Buddha, the vajra body of all TathÄgatas,
Vast and pervasive, boundless and immeasurable, responding to all directions and filling the sky,
Able to manifest many bodies from one body, and one body from many bodies,
Without a body and characteristics is the unconditioned,ğŸ”½Awakening to this samÄdhi and the palace of nirvÄá¹‡a,
One can enter the auspicious ground of the TathÄgata.
